oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Enterprise School

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Schools; Wooden buildings; One-room schools
Education - Tennessee; Education - History - Tennessee; School buildings - Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Simple wooden school building with a tin roof and brick chimney. Two windows and one door can be seen. A sign is posted on a wood beam in the front and it reads "Enterprise School." The building is in an empty, rural location with a few shrubs around it.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Education Schoolhouse Photos, 1938-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Enterprise School was a one-room school for African American students in Bells. Essie Sharpe was the principal and teacher for all grades, 1 through 7. In 1939, there were 30 students in attendance.
